title: How to pursue a career in business analytics - Quora

response.answer_text: It is 2019, and there is still a significant shortage of analytics/data science talent. Back in 2017, I was looking for answers to the same question. Hopefully, my answer can help those looking to move into the field right now. After my undergraduate studies, I swore I would never go back to school. But, after weighing the options I had, I realized that pursuing a Master’s in Business Analytics was the best option I had. Why, you ask? Here are the reasons that compelled me to pursue a Master’s in Business Analytics: Pros: 1. Academic Rigor Today, you can pick up almost any skill you want online. But analytics is a lot about statistical rigor, and other than a Master’s/Ph.D., few online programs would be able to instill that rigor. 2. Structured Learning One of my biggest problems with learning through online courses is that none of them are all-encompassing. Every course has knowledge gaps that you’ll have to cover, and in the end, you are facing a giant jigsaw puzzle of topics. A good Master’s program would cover ground in a structured manner, leaving avenues of self-learning open to the curious soul. 3. Social Learning and Networking You don’t learn alone; you learn in a cohort. When one of your classmates implements a new idea in a contest/project, you immediately learn it. You learn much more efficiently in a group. Eventually, these valued colleagues will become the most reliable links in your professional network. 4. Research Opportunities and Industry Projects Schools work with companies all the time on exciting research projects. Exposing you to current, real-world data science problems. Cons: 1. Cost of Attendance/ Opportunity Costs A lot of Master’s programs are prohibitively expensive. It is essential to consider the ROI (Return on Investment). Pick a school that has teaching assistantships and scholarships 2. Unpredictable Job Market/ Immigration Every business/field has a cycle of growth vs. cutting. While it is true that variable immigration policies are making it difficult to find jobs as international students, the shortage of data science professionals compensates for that difficulty. But where do I pursue my Master’s? In America. Why? Robust jobs market and some of the most significant advances in A.I have been from the U.S.A and Canada. Now, moving on to the next piece of the puzzle: Which schools do I consider? There are a lot of options. Many top schools offer 1-year programs in Business Analytics. These are better suited to professionals who already have an extraordinary profile or multiple years of relevant analytics experience. If that describes you, you need to be pursuing a 1-year program at schools such as UT Austin, University of Minnesota, University of Southern California, University of Cincinnati, etc. A quick lookup of the tuition costs will show you that most of the schools that fall in this category are quite expensive. In my case, I wanted to develop a strong foundation since I did not have relevant experience. I also wanted to experience American culture and take time to adjust to a new country, something that would be quite difficult to do in the short period of a 1-year program. My search for a school that would cover all the points I mentioned above brought me to Oklahoma State University’s MSBAN program. (Now known as MSBAnDS – Masters in Business Analytics and Data Science). Link: Business Analytics & Data Science - Oklahoma State University Here is why OSU MSBAN was right for me: 1.	MSBAnDS is a 21-month program, with a detailed and well-structured curriculum. 2.	It has a small batch size, allowing for close student-faculty interaction and individual attention. 3.	With ample internship, assistantship, and on-campus job opportunities, I could not find a better ROI from any other program. 100% of my cohort had full-time summer internships, and quite a few of them went on to have part-time “Co-op’s” in Fall and Spring. Most students work almost 7+ months as part of the program. 4.	90% of my cohort found a job within 3 months of graduation. 5.	Location advantage is real, but so is industry reputation. OSU’s MSBAnDS program has an excellent reputation in the industry. I gleaned this by following alums on LinkedIn and speaking to them about the program. It is also indicative through the program’s board of advisors. I’ve had the privilege of meeting several advisors through various networking events. 6.	At the time I was applying, there was no reliable source of ranking. Always read the methodology used to construct the scores for each school. Next, compare the programs through the curriculum and through the tuition and average salaries. You might find a lot of inconsistencies in these rankings! 7.	Stillwater is a college town that has a low cost of living and is exceptionally safe at any time of the day or night. 8.	It’s not all work, it’s also a lot of fun! With thanksgiving parties, tailgaters, and other events, I was able to have a fun social life as well! :D

I get about 30–40 messages everyday here and almost 60% of the times, it’s about my profile, “business analyst”. I already have a post on the same topic, but I thought it would be helpful to add more content based on the questions I have received so far. I am really really sorry if I have missed your message on this topic, after a point, I lost track of the messages. I have put in a lot of time to gather information and pen this down, so I really hope it’s useful. Analytics Profile - Analytics is a process that enables us to take data-driven decisions to improve our business performance. I work with the Business analytics team but there can be various domains within analytics depending upon the requirements of the business. Here are few - Business analytics that covers KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) like sales volume, revenue, user churn etcMarketing analytics that takes care of managing and tracking the performance of different marketing campaigns to optimize the ROI (return on investment)Product analytics that enables the business to understand their different products and improve customer experienceRisk analytics that makes sure the integrity of the company is maintained by mitigating possible risk sources and corresponding lossesThere are also other types like financial analytics, HR analytics, pricing analytics etc., Where to start? You could be interested in any of the above domains, but the basic skill set for an analyst profile is the same across all the domains. Only the business context and metrics change between all of them For a beginner, it’s important to have some knowledge on statistics. You can check out this course https://www.khanacademy.org/math/statistics-probabilityWhen you’re done with statistics, you need to improve your knowledge on other analytical and data science techniques, for which there is a website called ‘Analytics Vidhya’ and it’s quite useful - Learning Path - Data Science, Analytics, BI, Big DataWhen you’re done equipping yourself with theoretical concepts, use Kaggle datasets to apply them - Tutorials | No Free HunchAlso, the websites given below have very good analytics courses - Data Science Certificates | Coursera Data Analysis & Statistics Programming Languages - It’s important that you’re familiar with at least one querying language when you apply for an analytics profile. Few querying languages that are used to extract data are Teradata, MySQL, VBA Visualization Tools - There are many many data visualization tools. It’s not required that you know all the tools, but basic knowledge on common tools like Tableau, QlikView, Excel is mandatory Resume Preparation - A lot of people sent me messages asking about this as well. If you have previous experience on analytics, mention those projects. Please don’t add projects that you’ve not worked on (even if you’re a fresher in analytics). For any interviewer (who would also be a seasoned analyst) it wouldn’t take a lot of time to figure out that it’s not your project. Also, mention only those skills that you’re confident about Interview Preparation - For an analyst profile, other than written tests, they have some interview rounds that are common across all companies Case Study - You will be given a case study based on a business problem. Please invest more time in understanding the business case and the data set. It would involve some basic calculations, reading the trend and providing insights on the sameProbability - You can always expect one or two probability questionsGuesstimates - This one is very important. The questions might be as blah as “How many trees are in the US?”, “How many black cars are in India?”. The answer need not be perfect, of course you wouldn’t know the statistics. But what matters is the approach. So, you come up with a number (reasonable one) and explain with calculations why the number is right. Make sure you consider as many scenarios as possibleQuerying Languages - They can also ask for some small programs on the querying languages you have on your resumeThere will definitely be many questions on your previous projects. So, again, only add projects that you’ve worked on! How are the projects? An analyst profile is not only about data science projects, so please don’t have your expectations too high. You won’t be predicting and forecasting stuff every day. The type of projects can be as small as pulling just one number to creating excel reports or as big as prediction models If you’re prepared with all the above, then I’m sure you’re ready to be an analyst and you will definitely do great! All the best! P.S : And the remaining 40% of the messages, they are about my eye color and “yes, I have naturally colored eyes” *.*

Business Analytics is a hot career option right now. So first of all, congratulations on taking the first step towards pursuing that avenue. There are multiple ways you can pursue a career in business analytics. There are several online courses that you can register for on educational websites such as Coursera, Udemy, DataCamp. These websites are really helpful to learn at your own pace and to go over content as many times as you need to. There is also a Business Analytics certificate course from NSE that is like a 3 month course. Business Analytics Course with NSE Academy Certification | Data Analytics Course. These are good options if you are currently working and do not want to quit the job or if you are looking for an option that is economical while giving you a basic understanding of analytics. However, if time and economic conditions permit, I would genuinely recommend pursuing a Masters program. I was working for 5 years in India and then decided to go ahead with my plan to do Masters in Business Analytics and it is a decision I am very glad I made. There are multiple universities in US that focus on Business Analytics and offer a wide range of courses to choose from. Universities with a good Masters program while being reasonable in terms of fees would be: UT AustinOklahoma State UniversityPurdue UniversityUConnCMUWhile a simple google search will give you multiple options on what is the best university for pursuing business analytics in the US, I would like to share my personal experience with Masters. I applied for OSU because they have amazing opportunities to work as graduate teaching/research assistant. I personally was a graduate research assistant for 3 out of 4 semesters and my tuition fees were waived for the 3 semesters which made my Masters really affordable. More than 90% of the students had assistantship for 2 semesters out of 4. from the school of business. You are free to pursue opportunities outside the school of business for any of the semesters you don’t have an opportunity within department. Coming to the program (MS BANDS - Masters in Business Analytics and Data Science) and why it is different from other programs, this program is tailor-made by one of the most experienced analytics professors - Dr. Goutam Chakraborty. This program was a vision to bring in a small group of passionate students(class size is typically 35 to 37 students) and provide them full attention as opposed to putting students in classrooms of 100 and not giving any personal attention. Student faculty interaction is given utmost importance in this program and that is what I love about it. Dr.C puts tremendous effort into making sure the students have access to the most current technologies and information in the business. There is a certain level of personal touch that he puts into making sure each of his student is successful when they graduate out of this program. There are guest lectures from industry leaders every now and then. Training sessions are provided across multiple platforms. The course ensures you have couple of certifications before you graduate. It is a 2 year program of which 3 months would be your summer internship and 4 months advanced internship (if applicable). I did not do an advanced internship because I was still doing my research as a GRA. 100% students had paid internships for the past 2 years and 90% students received offers within 3 months of graduation. The course is also STEM designated which gives you enough time for 3 H1B attempts. The course also gives you an opportunity to work on several real time company projects. I personally find that very helpful because one gets to see real company data and gets to meet company leaders to discuss ideas for their company. Students also get to attend various analytics conferences in different part of the country with decent reimbursements provided by the department. Course curriculum is also quite flexible if you want to choose different avenues with analytics as your core such as HR Analytics, Health Analytics, Advanced Data Science, Marketing Analytics, Cyber Security Analytics etc . You can read more about the course on this link -> Business Analytics & Data Science - Oklahoma State University Besides all the great things this course offers on the academic side, it offers a great sense of community. The projects, events, classes and everything makes you bond as a cohort. I was an activities chair with the Business Analytics Students Association for a year. We conduct events throughout the year such as potluck parties, christmas parties, tailgating, graduate-alum mixers and so many more. The network that this program offers is irrefutable. I have met several of my friends that graduated from the top ranked programs who not only spent a lot more on their degrees than I did but also struggled to find internships/full time offers. This program was created after merging with MIS data science with MS BAN (The program I graduated from) and is less than 5 years old which makes it a very current course. It is also the reason why it is not ranked yet. I understand as students we tend to look at university ranking and program ranking but I would strongly suggest to get in touch with alums of the program that you plan to apply for because they speak from personal experience as I am right now. The campus is one of the best in the country. Stillwater is very reasonable place in terms of living expenses. The library is one of the best and so is the recreation center. The campus is extremely safe for women and international students. I have on several occasions stayed in the university till 2 or 3 am. Last but not least, I would be really happy to speak more about the program or any other questions you have regarding OSU. You can reach out to me on Linkedin (same name) if you are interested to discuss more. I hope whatever you choose to do, works out best for you. Good luck! :)

My suggestion would be to get the basic understanding of what business analytics is. Try to research what is included in business analytics (you can look at some university’s coursework to see what topics are covered in their business analytics degree) and then try to find online resources to learn the same. Business analytics is a field that is a cumulation of I.T. and statistics. You need to understand probability, among other topics, and you will need to know how to utilize Python/SQL to apply those statistical principles on the data that is provided to you. Business analytics may also include finance, marketing, Machine Learning, etc. So to pursue a career in it, I would suggest you get the basic understanding of what Business Analytics is using online sources like Coursera, Udemy, etc. Try to utilize your learning on datasets that are freely available on the internet. Websites like Kaggle provide tonnes of free data on various topics, and you can also visit websites like Yelp, Airbnb, etc. to get their own datasets and analyze those. Then, you can apply for a job related to Business Analytics. Another method to start a career in Business Analytics would be to get a degree in it. This one is a sure shot way to jump into Business Analytics especially if your current job/degree isn’t anything related to Business Analytics. However, this will require your complete dedication, energy , money and time for a specific period of time , which might range from a year to 2 years if you will be studying full time. Happy Learning! ~Saloni.

Hello! Business analytics provides a wide array of benefits: Enable data-driven decision making that has the potential to increase profits and improve efficiency. With predictive analytics, allow businesses to plan for the future in ways that were previously impossible. Helps a company make informed business decisions. A Company's Future Relies on Its Business Analytics. The need for effective, efficient business analytics is stronger than ever. Businesses need to know what they want to learn from business analytics—and then how they're going to use that data to inform their decisions across the board. The growing importance of Big Data across all parallels of the industry is driving companies and organizations to adopt both Business Analytics and Business Intelligence. Data in its raw form is of no use until it is analyzed and interpreted to uncover valuable insights. This is precisely where Business Analytics comes in.  Business Analytics refers to the study of Big Data by leveraging statistical and operations analysis, forming predictive models, employing optimization techniques, and communicating the results to all the stakeholders involved – team members, business partners, and customers. It focuses on quantitative methods and evidence-based data for business modeling and data-driven decision making. Usually, commercial organizations use Business Analytics to: Analyze data gathered from disparate sources.Monitor KPIs and respond to changing trends in real-time.Use advanced analytical and statistical techniques to uncover hidden patterns in massive datasets.Communicate information to relevant stakeholders through interactive dashboards and reports.Every company has three core goals – cost-optimization and reduction, maximizing customer satisfaction, and boosting profits. If leveraged correctly, Business Analytics can not only help companies accomplish these three objectives but also much more: Enhancing and speeding up the decision-making process.Making decisions that are aligned with the company business strategies.Responding to customer/client demands in real-time.Synchronizing financial and operational strategies.Keep pace with the latest industry trends to gain a competitive edge.In addition to your MBA core classes and business analytics concentration, you’ll complete an internship, practicum, or other experiential learning component. This will allow you to gain real-world experience as well as demonstrate to employers that you know how to apply your classroom learning in the field. There are many universities that offer this course, Indian Institute Of Management - [Iimb], BangaloreIndian Institute Of Management - [Iimc], KolkataNIT Trichy, TiruchirappalliLovely Professional University, PunjabGreat Lakes Institute of Management, ChennaiNarsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies, Mumbai From my personal experience,I would suggest you to go for LPU.The MBA in Business Analytics program at Lovely Professional University is a comprehensive program that covers the latest analytics tools and techniques along with their business applications. The topics would be covered in a practical and hands-on manner with real world case studies to enable participants to succeed in business roles using data analytics. Also, this program at LPU is in tie up with WileyNXT as well. This program at LPU enable the students to keep pace with changing technological advances, the university has industrial tie-up with WILEYNXT for this programme. I hope this helps. All the Best!

With more and more data being available online, business analytics has gained significant importance. Also, our hypercompetitive environment demands faster, smarter, data-based business decisions. There are many domains associated with analytics like business analytics, marketing analytics, product analytics, and risk analytics but each of them requires the basic skill set for analytics profile. So if you want to pursue a career in Business Analytics, this is how I feel you should start. ● For a fresher, it is necessary to have a basic knowledge of statistics. Once you’re done with statistics, you will require to improve your knowledge of analytical and data science techniques. Finally, you make use of online tutorials to apply them. ● You could get familiar with at least one query language especially MySQL. ● It is a good idea to gain knowledge of common tools like Tableau, QlikView, Excel. ● Increase awareness by reading blogs, attending industry forums, reading books, connecting to people within the industry and trying internships. ● In my personal view, TCS iON - ProCert certification on Analytics could enhance your value add and personal branding. It is a certification to help experienced professionals gain recognition for their analytics proficiency and enhance their industry credibility. Their certification website also assures interviews for candidates who clear it. The icing on the cake is that you may get a call from TCS themselves once certified. All the best!

Business Analytics is huge! Business Analytics helps in deciding how to use the data and what models can be used to make better business decisions. Business Analytics can be termed as ‘data science for businesses.’ While there are many models that can be used to take business decisions, business analytics assist in identification of the best possible model. Business Analytics is a procedure/study that uses all the statistical data available in an organisation to reach a constructive conclusion. Organisations hire business analysis experts who assess the previous reports of a company to understand if they are going on the right track. The past reports help them to evaluate whether the upcoming events are in favour of the organisation or against it. In both the cases, it is beneficial for the company. If the enterprise is on the right track, they can still improve, and if they are not, then it helps them in finding solutions to rectify the same. What is the Market Size of the Business Analytics sector? Read this entire article to know about market size, job prospects, courses available etc: Why Study Business Analytics? - Fusion Analytics World

I'll propose two approaches to pursue a career in business analytics. Firstly, Get a job that'll train you to acquire the essential skills. Now, this approach is better from a long term perspective but it takes time and investment. In India, the following companies are known for using cutting edge Analytics: ● Technology leaders: Google, Facebook, LinkedIn ● Banking, Financial Services and Insurance (BFSI): Capital One, American Express, ICICI, HDFC ● Telecom companies: Idea, Vodafone, Airtel ● Analytics Consultancies: Fractal, Mu-Sigma, Absolutdata, ZS Associates Secondly, Take up certifications that'll accelerate your career growth. With these certifications, you'll gain recognition for your domain experience and expertise. ● IIBA Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) ● PMI-Professional in Business Analysis (PBA) Certification ● TCS iON Procert Certification I recommend TCS iON’s ProCert certificate in Analytics as an immediate option to consider. This comes from TCS, one of the foremost thought leaders in the tech world. As per their website, the icing on the cake is that you may get an interview call from them once certified.

author_info.name: Institute of Business Management and Research

response.answer_text: Business Analytics is one of the few domains that has witnessed exponential growth over the decade. Today, almost every company is looking for individuals who have expertise in business analytics and big data. Considering the ever-growing demand, business analytics has become the most preferred career option for many individuals. If you are just starting, you are bound to have this question. To create a strong foundation for your career, we recommend getting a formal education like a PGDM or MBA in Business Analytics. A master's degree will not only give you a comprehensive understanding of this domain but will prepare you for the industry. While pursuing this post-graduate program, you can also get opportunities to intern or work with companies looking for business analysts. This will help you understand how to apply your knowledge in real-life situations and learn on-the-job. This is a safe and secure option to start a career in Business Analytics as it offers you complete knowledge and skills and allows you to work within the industry while being a fresher.

It depends on whic hstage of life you are in. If you are already working somewhere and cannot afford to leave your job, try to enroll for certification programs to learn. You can also get involved in an Analytics project and learn on the job. for certification programs, it is advisable that you go to the best colleges in the country. IIMs (ABC) have bvest pograms and then ISB. There are online programs as well, but they are of varied nature. Some are good, some good for nothing! On the other hand, if you are still a student, or can afford to take a sabbatical from your work, you may consider pursuing a full-time MBA. It will give you a solid base in terms of learning, and you’ll also be recognized immediately. apart from IIMs, Woxsen School of Business Hyderabad has an excellent program - PGDM in BA,ML & AI. It encompasses machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) along with Business Analytics (BA). The course is floated in tandem with Nanyang Technological University. The professors from this prestigious college will take many classes. Placement is guaranteed at 100% with high package.

Dear Aspirant, Business Analytics is the best course in the days to come. MBA in Business Analytics has a good scope and build management skills. It is a comprehensive program that covers the latest analytics tools and techniques along with their business applications. After obtaining an MBA in Business Analytics, you can get employment opportunities for the following posts: Data AnalystData ScientistBig Data AnalystBusiness AnalystQualitative AnalystTechnical Team LeadMarket Research AnalystData Mining ExpertData Warehousing ExpertBusiness Intelligence ExpertData Analyst SAS ProgrammeBusiness Analyst (Project Manager)Companies usually offer these job roles to candidates according to their domain knowledge, skill set, and work experience. MNCs, retail and manufacturing companies, IT firms, e-commerce companies, consultancies, telecom companies, and Business Analytics and Intelligence firms create a high demand for professionals with an MBA in Business Analytics. List of colleges for MBA in Business Analytics: IIM Calcutta, IILM University, Gurugram, Great Lakes Institute of Management, Amity University. Hope this help!

Business Analytics is one of the few domains that has grown exponentially over the decade. Today, it has become the most-preferred career option for many individuals. To make a career in business analytics, we recommend creating a strong foundation. To do this, you can pursue formal education like a PGDM or MBA in Business Analytics. A master's program will not only give you a comprehensive understanding of this domain but also prepare you to excel in it. While pursuing this post-graduate program, you can get opportunities to intern or work with companies who need business analysts. This will help you understand how to apply your knowledge in real-life situations and learn on-the-job. This is a safe and secure option to start a career in Business Analytics as it offers you complete knowledge and skills and allows you to work within the industry while being a fresher. Hopefully, this answer will help you understand how to first create a strong base and then make a career in this evolving field. Please feel free to get in touch with us if you have any other doubts.

Start with these Free online courses available on Coursera, Udacity, EdX etc .  I would the following link helpful as it mentions top 5 free online courses: http://analyticscourses.in/free-online-analytics-courses/  After completing any of these courses, if you are still interested in Analytics, then you can either go for a full time Business Analytics course. In India, I would suggest Great Lakes http://elearning.greatlakes.edu.in/pgpba/ as it has some of the course outline is pretty exhaustive with some of the best faculty in India for Business Analytics. Further, they have partnered with Jigsaw Academy (http://jigsawacademy.com/) which has been providing online analytics training in India for quite sometime.

A successful career in business analytics will usually require a combination of education and relevant experience. It is possible to meet the education requirement with a degree in statistics or mathematics and specific vendor-specific-postgraduate short courses. A masters degree or higher will make you even more competitive. Experience can be partially met with an internship before graduation. After graduation, the experience is best met if you have an analytics-specific position of at least one year. The size of the team, project and results created will be important. In summary, a combination of education and experience will be relevant to a successful career in analytics.

To pursue a career in business analytics, you first have to show the world you are competent enough to be a successful business analyst. And the first step for that would be getting a Masters degree in Business Analytics. But if you want a better picture of what job opportunities are available post your Masters degree, check out this post by CrackVerbal, it might be able to answer all your questions comprehensively All You Need To Know About Master’s in Business Analytics (MSBA) 2019

If you are a fresher you can get hired in a company that can train your on-the-job. Many companies invest in technical trainings for their employees to teach them the necessary skills required for their job. In order to make your CV attractive, you can take up short courses online that can teach you all about the basics of analytics. For people with prior work experience it is recommended that you take advanced courses that up skill your knowledge, as technology is a fast moving field, it is mandatory that you stay updated and at par with innovations. If you are a fresher then it is advised that you take up the basic courses that help you understand what analytics comprises of and its basic functions. This can surely help you crack the ATS and get yourself an interview at least.

Hi. I was reading a response from you relating to things you don’t regret doing and your social media presence and then ‘clicked’ on your business profile describing your analytics. My youngest daughter (28) is now attending school to get a masters in branding and strategy after running her own successful business for several years. It suddenly occurred to me that you already have many of the requisite skills required to run a company in Paris/Europe that could do the same. Rebranding yourself as someone who specializes in branding and strategy might open additional doors for you, especially if competition in your area is limited. Cheers.

You can pursue a career in business analytics by taking a course that enables you to be industry ready rather than theoretically feeding you with information. The SP Jain's Professional Program in Big Data & Visual Analytics is a highly stimulating and application-based program that combines technical and business knowledge to help you provide solutions to the challenges that Information Sciences and Big Data pose on corporations in the 21st century.

I guess in Analytics companies,role of an MBA person is to manage accounts and leading team..ofcourse,having knowldge of R and SAS will always help and enhanve your chances of getting job..But without that knowldge also you can apply for job..Analytics is comparatively new field..so companies dont expect to have deep knowledges of tools and languages..They train you on tools they use for data analysis...I guess you should apply for Job and once you get into analytics solution company u will learn things automatically... (On Job Training)

Business analytics is a broad field, and it might be wise to research all the possibilities within the field. To help you get started, you can check out this resource: The BI Skills Analysts Need To Start A Career In Business Intelligence

We would like to invite you to our Whatsapp group for Business Intelligence discussion and concept building. We use technologies such as Qlikview, Qliksense, Python. You can send a ping to 0018065436182 or follow our blog in Qlik View-Sense

Yes you can do it by learning Business analytics either in your own way or you can learn it on Internet. Best way is to learn it in your own way, increase your knowledge, & give an online exam. There are many services on Internet which can help you in this way.
hello, its not that much difficult you can get a degree or start with a short course gain some experience and you will be earning good.    https://www.apsense.com/brand/ResearchOptimus

A similar question has been answered here by me: Aatash Shah's answer to How can I make a good career in the data analytics industry? What are the skills I need to develop if I have to start from scratch?
